Structural Insulated Panels

Traditional Build
Construction times are reduced as you are doing 5 jobs at once when erecting the wall and roof panels. Balance Built's method of construction will incorporate traditional frame work but have bracing sheets either side and rigid insulation. Standard construction you are framing, insulating, external cladding and plastering internal walls. Traditional frame work uses cross bracing then infill the frame with insulation that can sag and move creating gaps that result in energy loss.
Building process is simplified using structural insulated panels as they are virtually impervious to termites, fire, insects, chemicals, corrosion, rust and mold. They are also contain absolutely no asbestos. Panels are pre-cut so as to reduce labour costs on site. All panels are labelled so as to simplify the build process. Timber frames can be affected by numerous substances and environments.
Blower tests done on SIP buildings give a reading of around __ a massive decrease in air leakage. Blower tests done on traditional builds return around __ so extreme air leakage.

  • Finally a environmentally friendly building system that reduces energy requirements and uses low embodied energy building products
  • With massive buying power savings can be passed on to the client
  • Build times reduced dramatically with increased numbers
